casebody.data:
Marlon EAGLIN
v.
EUNICE POLICE DEPARTMENT, et al. NO. 2017-C-1875 Supreme Court of Louisiana. March 9, 2018 IN RE: Chief Randy Fontenot, in His Official Capacity as Chief of Police for the City of Eunice; City of Eunice;-Defendant(s) Granted. See Order Attached. On Writ of Certiorari and/or Review, Twenty-Seventh Judicial District Court, Parish of St. Landry, No. C-161766-A, Division A; Court of Appeal, Third Circuit, No. 17-127. And, whereas, the Court has this date, pursuant to Article 5, Section 5, of the Constitution of Louisiana, made and issued the following order, to wit-"It is ordered that the writ of review issue; that the District Court and the Court of Appeal send up the record in Duplicate of the case; and that counsel for all parties be notified." Now, therefore, the said District Court and the Court of Appeal is hereby commanded, in the name of the State of Louisiana and of this Honorable Court, to send up forthwith to this Court, in accordance with Supreme Court Rule 1, at the City of New Orleans, the record in duplicate of the above-entitled case. Witness the Honorable Justices of the

Supreme Court of the State of Louisiana, on

this 9 th day of March, in the year of our

Lord, Two Thousand-Eighteen.

_________________________

John Tarlton Olivier

Clerk of Court

/s/

Deputy Clerk of Court
